name: Stannum
Relationship: Complementary: PULS. Compare: STANN. IOD. 3X. (Valuable in chronic chest diseases characterized by plastic tissue changes. Persistent inclination to cough, excited by tickling dry spot in the throat, apparently at root of tongue. Dryness of throat. Trachial and bronchial irritation of smokers. Pulmonary symptoms; cough, loud, hollow, ending with expectoration. (Phellandrium.) State of purulent infiltration. ADVANCED phthisis sometimes when Stann. jod. has not taken effect, an additional dose of Iodine in milk caused the drug to have its usual beneficial effect. (Stonham.) Compare: CAUST.; CALC.; SIL.; TUBERC.; BACIL.; HELON. MYRTUS CHEKAN (chronic bronchitis, cough of phthisis, emphysema, with gastric catarrhal complications and thick, yellow difficult sputum. Old persons with weakened power of expectoration.)

Head: Drawing pains in malar bones and orbits
Jarring of walking resounds painfully in head
Aching in temples and forehead
Pain worse motion; gradually increasing and decreasing as if constricted by a band; forehead feels pressed inwards
Ulceration of ring hole in lobe of ear
Obstinate acute coryza and influenza with cough
Respiratory: Hoarse; mucus expelled by forcible cough
During day, with copious green, sweetish, expectoration
Violent, dry cough in evening until midnight
Influenzal cough from noon to midnight with scanty expectoration
Chest feels weak; can hardly talk
Respiration short, oppressive; stitches in left side when breathing and lying on same side
Cough excited by laughing, singing, talking; worse lying on right side
Stomach: Pain better pressure, but sore to touch
Abdomen: Cramp-like colic around navel, with a feeling of emptiness
Fever: Perspiration, principally on forehead and nape of neck; debilitating; smelling musty, or offensive
Heat in evening; exhausting night-sweats, especially towards morning
Female: Prolapsus, with weak, sinking feeling in stomach
Pain in vagina, upward and back to spine
Throat: Much adhesive mucus, difficult to detach; efforts to detach cause nausea
Sleep: Sleeps with one leg drawn up, the other stretched out
Extremities: Limbs suddenly give out when attempting to sit down
Spasmodic twitching of muscles of forearm and hand

details: Chief action is centered upon the nervous system and respiratory organs. Debility is very marked when Stannum is the remedy, especially the debility of chronic bronchial and pulmonary conditions, characterized by profuse mucopurulent discharges upon tuberculosis basis. TALKING CAUSES A VERY WEAK FEELING IN THE THROAT AND CHEST. PAINS THAT COME AND GO GRADUALLY, call unmistakably for Stannum. Paralytic weakness; spasms; paralysis.
